text: Why was it so particularly¬†popular in Brazil?
author: Marcus M√ºhrmann-Lund

text: That's because we have video games too,¬†and we liked it very much.
author: Felipe Alencar

text: Because the game was launched on the peak of Ayrton Senna's career.
author: Filipe Lima

text: Oh, ok, yeah¬†that makes a lot of sense, Filipe.
author: Marcus M√ºhrmann-Lund

text: maybe cause it was easy to find this game in 90s, easy to play and 2 player mode that you can help your friend to finish the game (different other good racing games that you just have versus mode with no CPU). Brazil early 90s suffered with insane inflation, so, everything was hard to buy, it was very difficult to get a videogame, and when you had it, rarely you could buy new games, that's why everyone rent it or went to friend's house to play together with them... that's why every huge success game in Brazil, was games that had 2 player coop-mode, that take days and days to beat the game (the reason that you love when your friends come to your house to help you) or has a very very very good replay at versus mode (like Street Fighter II and Mortal Kombat II). Single player games wasn't so popular...

author: Starscream2040

text: Oh man... Oh maaaaaaaaaaaan. Nostalgia overload ;^; I remember when my brother and I first got this game way back when. I must have only been 6 or 7 at the time. It was one of the first two player games we had so I was especially excited because that meant I could play with my older brother lol. We would play this and fzero for hours while eating cheerios. Now those days are long gone. We're both adults and he's even a father now. Where has the time gone? T^T
